required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Assess the Long-term Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of Macitentan in Subjects With Eisenmenger Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Long Term, Single-arm, Open-label Extension Study of Protocol AC-055-305 to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Macitentan in Subjects With Eisenmenger Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: Long-term study to evaluate if macitentan is safe, tolerable and efficient enough to be used for treatment of Eisenmenger syndrome.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Primary endpoint of parent study AC-055-305/MAESTRO (NCT01743001) not met.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Exercise Capacity as Measured by 6-minute Walking Distance (6MWD) Month 6 and 12
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline in DB parent study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001) up to month 12 in this OL study.
primary_outcome.description: NOTE: The MAESTRO-OL study was exploratory in nature and no primary efficacy and safety endpoint were defined in the clinical protocol. This and the other exploratory efficacy outcome measures posted were selected to be reported as a primary endpoints. All efficacy analyses were considered exploratory. The analyses of the exploratory efficacy endpoints focused on the absolute values and on the change from DB baseline to Week 16 in the DB study and to Month 6 and Month 12 in the OL study. For missing 6MWD values in the OL study, the following imputation rules were applied: If the reason for missing data was death, a distance of zero (0) meters was imputed for all 6MWD visits from the date of death. For any other reasons, the last available value was carried forward.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in WHO Functional Class (FC) at Month 6 and 12
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline in DB parent study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001) up to month 12 in this OL study.
primary_outcome.description: Class I: no symptoms with exercise or at rest. No limitation of activity. Class II: No symptoms at rest but slight limitation with ordinary activities causing symptoms (e.g. short of breath with climbing stairs). Class III: may not have symptoms at rest but activities greatly limited by shortness of breath, fatigue, or near fainting. Class IV: symptoms at rest and inability to carry out any physical activity without symptoms. Patients in class IV manifest signs of right heart failure. For missing WHO FC values in the OL study, the following imputation rules were applied: If the reason for missing data was death, class IV was imputed for all WHO visits from the date of death. For any other reasons, the last available value was carried forward.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Borg Dyspnea Score at Month 6 and 12
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline in DB parent study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001) up to month 12 in this OL study.
primary_outcome.description: The Borg dyspnea score rates the severity of dyspnea (difficult or labored breathing) on a scale from 0 ('Nothing at all') to 10 ('Very, very severe - maximal'). For missing Borg dyspnea index values in the OL study, the following imputation rules were applied: If the reason for missing data was death, a value of 10 was imputed for all Borg visits from the date of death. For any other reasons, the last available value was carried forward.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Peripheral Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) at Rest at Month 6 and 12
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline in DB parent study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001) up to month 12 in this OL study.
primary_outcome.description: No imputation of missing data for SpO2 was applied. Oxygen saturation assessed by pulse oximetry: peripheral oxygen saturation (SpO2) at rest before the 6-minute walk test (6MWT)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Subjects with ES (including those with Down Syndrome) having completed the double-blind AC-055-305 / MAESTRO study as scheduled, i.e., who remained in the double-blind study up to Week 16 (whether or not they were still taking study drug at the end of this period).
Exclusion Criteria:
Subjects who prematurely discontinue double-blind study drug during the AC-055-305 / MAESTRO study due to:
- an AE assessed as related to the use of study drug,
- or elevated liver tests (related or unrelated to study drug).

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 51 sites in 19 countries (geographical regions: Asia-Pacific, Eastern Europe, Latin America, North America and Western Europe).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 217 of 221 subjects (111 macitentan, 110 placebo) that completed treatment in the AC-055-305/MAESTRO double-blind (DB) parent study (NCT01743001) were enrolled in the open-label (OL) study without knowledge of their study treatment allocation in the DB study (macitentan or placebo).

group.title: DB-macitentan
group.description: All subjects treated with macitentan in the DB study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001).

group.title: DB-placebo
group.description: All subjects treated with placebo in the DB study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001).

group.title: DB-macitentan
group.description: All enrolled subjects treated with macitentan in the AC-055-308 / OL study who received macitentan in the DB study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001).

group.title: DB-placebo
group.description: All enrolled subjects treated with macitentan in the AC-055-308 / OL study who received placebo in the DB study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001).

class.title: Asia-Pacific

measure.title: WHO Functional Class (FC)
measure.description: WHO functional class of subjects Class I: no symptoms with exercise or at rest. No limitation of activity. Class II: No symptoms at rest but slight limitation with ordinary activities causing symptoms (e.g. short of breath with climbing a flight of stairs, grocery shopping, or making the bed). Class III: may not have symptoms at rest but activities greatly limited by shortness of breath, fatigue, or near fainting. Class IV: symptoms at rest (e.g. dyspnea and/or fatigue) and inability to carry out any physical activity without symptoms. Patients in class IV manifest signs of right heart failure

outcome.title: Change in Exercise Capacity as Measured by 6-minute Walking Distance (6MWD) Month 6 and 12
outcome.description: NOTE: The MAESTRO-OL study was exploratory in nature and no primary efficacy and safety endpoint were defined in the clinical protocol. This and the other exploratory efficacy outcome measures posted were selected to be reported as a primary endpoints. All efficacy analyses were considered exploratory. The analyses of the exploratory efficacy endpoints focused on the absolute values and on the change from DB baseline to Week 16 in the DB study and to Month 6 and Month 12 in the OL study. For missing 6MWD values in the OL study, the following imputation rules were applied: If the reason for missing data was death, a distance of zero (0) meters was imputed for all 6MWD visits from the date of death. For any other reasons, the last available value was carried forward.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline in DB parent study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001) up to month 12 in this OL study.

This and the other exploratory efficacy outcome measures posted were selected to be reported as a primary endpoints. All efficacy analyses were considered exploratory. The analyses of the exploratory efficacy endpoints focused on the absolute values and on the change from DB baseline to Week 16 in the DB study and to Month 6 and Month 12 in the OL study. For missing 6MWD values in the OL study, the following imputation rules were applied: If the reason for missing data was death, a distance of zero (0) meters was imputed for all 6MWD visits from the date of death. For any other reasons, the last available value was carried forward.

outcome.title: Change in WHO Functional Class (FC) at Month 6 and 12
outcome.description: Class I: no symptoms with exercise or at rest. No limitation of activity. Class II: No symptoms at rest but slight limitation with ordinary activities causing symptoms (e.g. short of breath with climbing stairs). Class III: may not have symptoms at rest but activities greatly limited by shortness of breath, fatigue, or near fainting. Class IV: symptoms at rest and inability to carry out any physical activity without symptoms. Patients in class IV manifest signs of right heart failure. For missing WHO FC values in the OL study, the following imputation rules were applied: If the reason for missing data was death, class IV was imputed for all WHO visits from the date of death. For any other reasons, the last available value was carried forward.

For missing Borg dyspnea index values in the OL study, the following imputation rules were applied: If the reason for missing data was death, a value of 10 was imputed for all Borg visits from the date of death. outcome.title: Change in Peripheral Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) at Rest at Month 6 and 12
outcome.description: No imputation of missing data for SpO2 was applied. Oxygen saturation assessed by pulse oximetry: peripheral oxygen saturation (SpO2) at rest before the 6-minute walk test (6MWT)
outcome.time_frame: From baseline in DB parent study (AC-055-305, NCT01743001) up to month 12 in this OL study.
outcome.population: No imputation of missing data for oxygen saturation as assessed by SpO2 was applied. Therefore out of 109 subjects 104 subjects were analyzed at month 6 and 92 subjects at month 12 in the DB-macitentan group. In the DB-placebo group out of 108 subjects 103 subjects were analyzed at month 6 and 84 subjects at month 12.

reported_events.time_frame: From open label study treatment initiation up to 30 days after study treatment discontinuation (max. 24 months + 30 days).
reported_events.desc: All 217 subjects enrolled in this single-arm open-label (OL) study received 10 mg macitentan to be taken daily and are therefore presented as one group (= all-enrolled analysis set) to report the adverse events in this OL study. From these 217 total subjects 109 received macitentan and 108 placebo in the parent double-blind (DB) study (AC-055-305/MAESTRO, NCT01743001).

group.title: All-enrolled Analysis Set
group.description: The all-enrolled analysis set includes all subjects enrolled in AC-055-308 / MAESTRO-OL (217 subjects total). All subjects received a film-coated tablet with 10mg mactientan to be taken orally on a daily basis.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any study-related article or abstract written independently by investigators must be submitted to Actelion for review at least 60 days prior to submission for publication or presentation. The list of authors of any formal publication or presentation of study results may include, as appropriate, representatives of Actelion, and will be determined by mutual agreement.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The MAESTRO parent study AC-055-305 (NCT01743001) did not meet its primary endpoint. The sponsor decided to prematurely terminate this OL study on January 12th 2018.
